result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M. Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will consider expungement in 2 years upon submitting a letter to the Court.
***AJOC - Probation is for 18 months***

miscConds.notes: If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
**  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not have contact with Andre S, Melissa S or their residence, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 1
***AJOC - Probation is for 18 months***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley M. Moore

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation
of DNA Collection

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Attorney Terry William Rose in court with Defendant Bradley M. Moore.  Clerk: PU
  Minutes:  DE has no objection to proceeding before Judge Gabriele today.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Amended Information filed by the State.  DE paid restitution up front and case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to DE in court.   Counts 1 & 2 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 18 months with conditions.  Both counts are concurrent.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Court will consider an expungement in 2 years upon submitting a letter to the court.  Appeal Rights given.

Defendant, Bradley M. Moore, appeared.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   DE not eligible for SPD.   Court hold colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se today.  DE waives attorney for today's hearing and completes waiver paperwork.  State places plea offer on the record.    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered by the Court. .  Bond continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  kmk

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on March 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk
